Noncredit Offerings                                                                   Claim Your Digital NYU School of Professional Studies Noncredit Certificate Badge                                                                        Play                              Noncredit Offerings at the NYU School of Professional Studies        The NYU School of Professional Studies is a leader in noncredit continuing education. People from across the country and around the world enroll in our noncredit courses , certificates , online offerings , and intensives . Professionally oriented programs are offered as well as those geared toward personal enrichment. Day, evening, and weekend schedules are available to fit your busy lifestyle. Courses are taught by top industry professionals, who provide you with the latest information in your area of interest.   No matter what your passion or career path, you will find that the School offers a noncredit learning environment like no other. From Creating Websites for Mobile Devices to Collecting and Appraising Rare Books , there is something for everyone.            Noncredit Certificate Digital Badge     Noncredit Academic Policies and Procedures    Noncredit Information Sessions     Dorothy Durkin Torch Circle Benefits    High School Academy     Intensives    Professional Advantage               Ready to Proceed?     Search for a Course Now       Download Summer 2015 Bulletin          Courses     Noncredit courses can provide the information needed to hone your current skills, learn new ones, or simply enrich your life. Choose from thousands of courses that are offered online and onsite. Many can apply towards earning noncredit certificates .         Certificates     More than 100 noncredit certificates are available from which to choose. These programs are comprised of required courses and elective courses that allow you to tailor your program of study to meet your professional goals.           Online Offerings     The NYU School of Professional Studies offers a large number of online noncredit courses. So, you can learn at home, at work, or on the road. Some courses are offered completely online, while others combine online and onsite instruction.                                                                            Advanced Certificate Search                                                       New Courses     New noncredit courses offered by the School put you on the fast track to success by helping you to acquire new skills and to expand upon existing knowledge. A wide selection of new courses are added throughout the semester.           Explore New Courses       Intensives     Intensive programs offer course content in condensed formats. They run throughout the year, but are most prevalent during the summer months. Programs range from 1-12 weeks and provide total immersion in subject matter.           Learn More About Intensives       Register for Courses     To register for a course, call (212) 998-7150; visit sps.nyu.edu ; or visit us in person at 7 East 12th Street, Room 133, Mon.–Thurs., 9 a.m.–7 p.m.; Fri., until 5 p.m; and Sat.–Sun. 9 a.m.–6 p.m.             Create an Account         Login to Your Account to Register                                               QUICK LINKS                        About Us          Student Affairs          Visit Us          School-wide Policies          Contact Us                       ATTEND THE SCHOOL                        Graduate Admissions          Undergraduate Admissions          Noncredit Registration          High School Academy          Professional Advantage                             ON THE WEB                         On Facebook          On Twitter          On YouTube          Browser Requirements                                                        NYU Homepage    © New York University School of Professional Studies | Privacy Policy

Noncredit Offerings                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                       Humanities, Arts, and Writing                                                                                           About             Director's Message Faculty News                   Admissions                 Academics             M.S. in Professional Writing Noncredit Offerings                   Career                 Events             Art Law Day Art Crime Symposium                   Highlights             Movies 101 Modern British Drama in London Oxford University Study Program                                                     Noncredit Offerings                                            Academics ›                M.S. in Professional Writing            Noncredit Offerings                 Certificate in Appraisal Studies in Fine and Decorative Arts          Certificate in Art Business          Certificate in Art Collections Management and Display          Certificate in Art Marketing and Communications          Certificate in Arts Administration          Certificate in Book Publishing: Print and Digital          Certificate in Communication Skills          Certificate in Creative Writing          Certificate in Editing          Certificate in Journalism: Print and Digital Media          Certificate in Magazine and Website Publishing          Certificate in Screenwriting          Summer Intensive in Creative Writing                                  Ready to Proceed?           Register Now        Request Information        Events                                                                  Whether your goal is to move ahead in your career, change your professional direction, or deepen your appreciation of the humanities, arts, and writing, you’ll find a rich array of noncredit courses and certificates from which to choose. Explore subjects that stir your imagination with faculty members who are eager to share their expertise and their passion. Enjoy the intellectual stimulation of a vibrant learning community.           Ready to Proceed?        Register for Courses Now                 Noncredit Courses        Whether analyzing an artistic masterpiece, taking in a theatrical performance, or immersing yourself in a creative writing project, studying the world's greatest forms of human expression provides an ideal way to broaden your horizons. Through thought-provoking discussion and intellectual exploration, the NYU School of Professional Studies continuing education courses in the humanities and the performing arts help you to sharpen your critical thinking skills, engage in cultural discovery, and communicate with diverse audiences.   Our courses in literature, film, theater, performing arts, history, archaeology, philosophy, and religion can spark your curiosity and challenge you to view the world from a fresh perspective. Read and discuss great books. Discover the masters of American cinema or become engrossed in the work of modern European philosophers. Explore New York City's theater scene as an audience member or take to the stage in one of our many acting and performance courses.            A Selection of Courses From This Department                                              Appraisal of Historical Textiles and Clothing                                                            Great Choral Compositions in Classical Music                                                            Independent Study in Photography                                                            Literature and Film Go Back to High School                                                            Manhattan's Residential Secrets                                                            Writing Film Dialogue                                                                               View all Humanities, Arts, and Writing Noncredit Courses           Certificates        If you’re seeking an effective way to move your career forward, earning a noncredit certificate through the NYU School of Professional Studies allows you to acquire proficiency in a specific professional arena. Designed to accommodate the schedules of busy professionals, certificate programs offer in-depth knowledge and unique insights into subject matter, allowing you to gain significant expertise and industry-specific skills. This powerful credential can help you to achieve your career goals and greatly enhance your résumé.                                     Certificate in Appraisal Studies in Fine and Decorative Arts                                       Certificate in Art Business                                       Certificate in Art Collections Management and Display                                         Certificate in Art Marketing and Communications                                       Certificate in Arts Administration                                       Certificate in Book Publishing: Print and Digital                                         Certificate in Communication Skills                                       Certificate in Creative Writing                                       Certificate in Editing                                         Certificate in Journalism: Print and Digital Media                                       Certificate in Magazine and Website Publishing                                       Certificate in Screenwriting                               Ready to Proceed?
